attributes.action: Give the local authority the power to direct academy schools to take a child.
attributes.background: Our 8 year old son with additional needs suffered sustained & violent bullying from a child over 4 years culminating in a significant mental health breakdown. The school can not & will not deal with the bullying. We now cannot get our son into a new school.
attributes.additional_details: Our son was removed from school to safeguard him as the school we were moving him to had conceded an appeal to take him meaning only out of school for 2 weeks, only for the new school to then rescind the offer, two further schools will now not accept him, all three sighting they require an educational health care plan to review first. No agency appears to be interested to grip this, EFA have sent it back to the local authority who have no authority over academies. 106 days out of education now.

attributes.action: Unemployment and behaviour rehabilitation.  National service.
attributes.background:
1. Children/Adults on leaving school will be enrolled in a national service programme if they are not in employment or further education with 3 months of leaving school.

2. Young offenders 16-25 are entered into the national service programme for rehabilitation.
attributes.additional_details:
1a. They will recieve a set of skills and further education for a good platform in life and to be a working citizen.
1b. They recieve a wage which pays taxes back not benefits.
1c. Money taken and put into a fund for them when service is finished to help them with a start in life.

2a. Takes down over crowding in prisons.
2b. Gives them a set of skills and trade to give back something to community's. Something were they feel wanted.
2c. Reduces tax payers costs to prisoners.
2d. Pays taxes back.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate an international intervention on Trump's US climate policy
attributes.background:
The Trump administration intends to revive a fossil-fuel economy and withdraw from the Paris Agreement.

If US climate policy undermines global climate change targets, the UK government should intervene on behalf of the UK population and co-ordinate the intervention of other nations as well.

attributes.action: Create an impartial ombudsman to put PIP mandatory service levels in place
attributes.background: The DWP want to cut costs, but the costs are rising due to disabled people having to have claim reviewed and then appealed. A high number of cases are overturned at appeal meaning PIP is paid plus the administration of reviewing a case which should have been awarded in the first place.
attributes.additional_details:
pip sucess rate new claimants 47%
pip sucess rate DLA to PIP migrations 74%
pip sucess rate average overall 60.5 % (before tribunals)
pip failure rate 39.5%
65% of claimants will go to tribunal 

The ombudsman should be able to put statutory service levels in place to protect disabled people and the DWP against failures of quality made by 3rd party contractors such as atos and capita

attributes.action: Enforce disabled access in the UK rather than ignoring the issue
attributes.background:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable adjustments.

Its time the UK took action to make disabled access mandatory in all businesses and for those who fail to be fined by their local authority.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable 
adjustments for disabled people to have equal access to their services.

Its time councils had the power to issue fines, warnings and even court action against businesses that fail to comply with disability access law. Too little is being done to enforce this and a good number of disabled people do not have the energy to take these issues through court.

attributes.action: Where a partner dies before Retirement Age,transfer pension to Partner,for 5yrs
attributes.background: As part of the social care package I would propose that all persons whose life companion, partner, spouse, Husband or Wife died before that reached the stipulated Retirement Age to receive their partners pension, non-means-tested, for a period of Five years after the date of the loved one.
attributes.additional_details: This would also ease the burden on social care and health and be a clear signal of a Steadfast commitment to tackle the crisis of pensioner poverty, social care, and relive the impossible burden upon our NHS

attributes.action: Introduce Government subsidies on public transport for full time students.
attributes.background: Studying in full time education can cost families a sufficient amount of money each year on transport to school and recreational activities which they may not have. This can cost families and students thousands of pounds every year which they can spend on other costs in the household like books.
attributes.additional_details: For a bus ticket from Seaton to Exeter it costs a student Â£10 for a return trip which the money can be used for a text book from school.Therefore  the government should subsidie public transport for students in full time education.

attributes.action: Improve the A21. Eliminate blindspots and place speed cameras along Kent street
attributes.background: There have been a number of fatalities along Kent street in 2016. One being on the 13 of August. Vast stretches of the a21 are seriously outdated and need improving. I'm asking that the government improve the a21 especially Kent street, by eke imitating blindspots and placing average speed cameras.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of letters to the government by residents of Kent street asking for changes, but nothing has been done. All the plans to improve the a21 have been shelved, and I'm asking that the government step in and change the road. 4 fatalities this year are evidence that something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics and Citizenship to the core UK school curriculum
attributes.background: In light of the recent Brexit and US presidential election, we strongly believe that all students should understand the nature of politics and their role and responsibilities as citizens and voters.

attributes.action: Hold a Parliamentary debate on Social Media Abuse
attributes.background: Social media abuse, including cyberbulling, trolling, sexting and grooming, are negatively affecting thousands of teenagers' lives on a daily basis, culminating in self harm, alcoholism, mental illness and suicide. We wish for the companies responsible to take additional steps to police their sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NSPCC, along with Barnados, have a huge amount of data highlighting the serious issues teenagers are dealing with when becoming victims of social media abuse. Not enough safeguards are deployed within these sites to deal with the amount of abuse aimed at our children which leave parents in total despair. The level of abuse affects our children in many ways with poor exam results, disengagement within society, drug and alcohol abuse, eating disorders and in some cases self harm and suicide.

attributes.action: Remove Council Tax Payments for families earning below Â£22000 a year.
attributes.background: Council tax is forever growing year upon year. With each new financial tax year we see it rise by a percentage every year. When will it become tone expensive to pay. Why do we have to pay such high tariffs. NOW is the time to help struggling families who scrape every penny together.

attributes.action: Conduct a 2nd, more complex, EU membership referendum with multiple answers.
attributes.background: The first EU membership referendum had polarised wording and lacked options which truly reflected the range of sentiment toward the EU found across the UK. To empower the people, a more complex range of possible outcomes should be provided which serves both the voter and the EU/next generation.
attributes.additional_details: 1st EU referendum.

attributes.action: Please give extra money to keep our Isle of Wight acute inpatient hospital open.
attributes.background: Hampshire and Isle of Wight Sustainability and Transformation Plan [HIOW STP] has been published. The plan is to reduce overall running costs in the area. But we might lose 300 hospital beds. Acutely ill Isle of Wight patients need inpatient facilities near to home, not "ferried to the mainland".
attributes.additional_details: https://onthewight.com/petitions-protect-health-services-on-the-isle-of-wight-gaining-support/

attributes.action: Give a fine to parents if their children are persistent bullies.
attributes.background: I am asking for this petition to be signed so parents realise if they do not prevent their children from bullying other children persistently they would face a fine.
attributes.additional_details: As an aunty to my niece, who was bullied on many occasions, mainly from the same girl, I'm sure I speak for many parents who have found it devastating to watch someone go through this ordeal. This not only affects them, it actually changes them as a person. So would really be greatful for this to come into effect.

attributes.action: Provide a clear and open way to reply to government responses to petitions
attributes.background: The petitions website was set up as a way for the electorate to influence policy and hold the government to account. While this is an excellent tool for improving communication between the public and the government, the responses are frequently dismissive with no recourse for the public to reply.
attributes.additional_details:
When responses are dismissive or ignore the core concerns of the people, it increases disillusionment and leads to disenfranchisement. In order to improve the power of this democratic tool to hold the government to account, there needs to be a clear, open and visible way for the public to reply to the government responses. 

Please provide a way for the public to reply and engage with government responses to improve the power of this tool.

attributes.action: End the ban on the creation of new grammar schools
attributes.background: Planned expansions of existing grammar schools will not be enough to address educational inequality; bright children who live nowhere near to a potential expanded grammar school are being failed.  The ban on the creation of new grammar schools must be repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
Your postcode should not determine your quality of education. Yet the gulf between the worst and best state schools is large and for many, private school is not an option. This has created severe educational inequality, which academic selection will help to address.

Grammar schools should be a top priority in improving opportunities for bright, poorer students. The government should allow the creation of new grammar schools to widen access to a rigorous, traditional and academic education.

attributes.action: Regulate agency fees for tenants in the letting market to reduce excessive fees.
attributes.background: Letting agencies vary widely in the fees they charge from company to company and by region. It is often unclear exactly what you are paying for. High reference fees, checkout fees, and other charges, on top of depoisits, are unfair to tenants and make moving home unaffordable to many.

attributes.action: Make "sex and relationship" education compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: All teenagers need to learn about appropriate, consensual relationships and sex. Some young people are lucky enough to have appropriate and necessary talks with parents/carers but this is not always the case so needs to be the responsibility of schools.
attributes.additional_details: This is especially crucial for young LGBT+ people because it is unlikely that many parents/carers will cover LGBT+ issues with their children. Look at the "legacy" that Section 28 has left, including a high proportion mental health issues among LGBT+. Faith schools are not exempt from this because they do not agree with homosexuality, if anything it is even more crucial that LGBT students here are set up for a healthy adult life.

attributes.action: Debate the implementation of a carbon tax in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Climate change is currently happening and economic experts cite a carbon tax as a solid and progressive step. Reducing carbon consumption and also taxation needed from other sources. 

Carbon tax would drastically reduce the rates of income tax. More money for you and a better environment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.carbontax.org/why-a-carbon-tax/

'A robust tax on carbon pollution will create powerful incentives inducing policy-makers and individuals to reduce carbon emissions through conservation, substitution and innovation' 

'Currently, the prices of electricity, gasoline and other fuels reflect little or none of the long-term costs from climate change or even the near-term health costs of burning fossil fuels'

attributes.action: Let merchants choose to trade using Imperial and/or Metric measurements.
attributes.background: EU law requires UK merchants to display weights and measures in metric units. Simultaneous display of Imperial units is allowed as an afterthought. Per Brexit, Parliament should enact a law allowing merchants to choose to display weights and measures in either Imperial or Metric units, or jointly.

attributes.action: Make it law that all cyclists have to wear helmets.
attributes.background: After seeing the damage falling from a bicycle can cause I feel it should now be law for anyone using a cycle to have to wear a cycle helmet !  More bicycles are now capable of the same speeds as mopeds and scooters and some electric bicycles can reach speeds in excess of 20mph! lets make this law..
attributes.additional_details:
Studies show that wearing a helmet can make it 70% less likely that you suffer major head trauma should you fall off or be involved in an accident while riding a bicycle. If you think your to cool to wear one spend an hour in the NCCU and think again.
We have rules and regulations for many things less damaging lets make this law and save lives.

attributes.action: Hold an Emergency General Election, to be held no later than February 20th 2017.
attributes.background: In order to restore public faith in the Democratic process, the public should be given the option to affirm its faith in the current government or to overturn it in a General Election.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May demanded the Same action when Gordon Brown took power in 2007.
The Fixed Term Parliament Act 2011 has provisions so that under certain circumstances a snap General Election may be held.
The Government has already Ignored numerous Petitions this year including the Largest Petition in British Political history.
The Leadership Crises that plagued almost all the Major Political Parties in Parliament should allow the British Public to have their say once again in a General Election.

attributes.action: Increase awareness and services for those suffering from eating disorders
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask that the government both develop greater awareness and increase funding to mental health services for those suffering from an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of students from the University of Exeter campaigning to raise awareness of the lack of support for sufferers of eating disorders, particularly in the South West.

attributes.action: Empower the Police to seize and destroy Mobile Phones
attributes.background: So many people are killed or injured every week as a result of road traffic accidents where mobile phone distraction is the cause. Please sign & support this petition. you will be saving lives!

attributes.action: Waive the Police charges for the return of stolen vehicles to victims
attributes.background: Like many people I was recently the victim of motorcycle theft,  the police recently found the vehicle and told me it was subject to a Â£40 a day holding charge.  This is nothing but shameful profiteering on a victims loss from the Metroploitan Police a their policy should be changed.

attributes.action: Allow the british army to grow beards like the navy
attributes.background: It should be allowed for the british army to grow beards, the navy are allowed so why isnt the army? If you are in the british army and you are a sikh then you can grow a beard, this goes against equalitiy and diversity.
attributes.additional_details: The navy has regulations and guidelines for what classes as a beard, why can the army not have the same?

attributes.action: ban betting advertising and sponsorship on television and UK press.
attributes.background:
the level of betting advertising is growing out of control.
Its everywhere;
TV adverts
Programme sponsorship
TV channel sponsorship
Sports event sponsors

Most offer free bets, or free money bets as incentives.

Gambling is addictive and destroys family life.
attributes.additional_details:
The way in which betting companies advertise need strict control, to curb the ever increasing problem of gambling addiction.
The massive increase in the number of online betting sites being able to fund such promotional activity is testimony to their success at the expense of UK households.

This is not the kind of enterprise we should be promoting.

attributes.action: Transfer SouthEastern and Southern services to TfL from 2018 onwards
attributes.background: This petition demands that management and accountability for London's failing Metro services is handed over to TfL and operated under London Overground. Starting with 2018 SouthEastern services to and from Dartford followed by Southern services and others as and when current franchises expire.
attributes.additional_details: Chris Grayling MP has rejected the Mayor of London's proposal to allow TfL to take full control over the failing Southern and SouthEastern franchises when they expire. The London Overground unit has a proven track record of improving punctuality, cleanliness, staffing levels and frequency. Profits are reinvested into the network meaning that services are run for the benefit of passengers. Chris Grayling made a mess of our prisons - we need to stop him doing the same to our transport.

attributes.action: Give free public transport to homeless people in UK
attributes.background: Whilst we find ways and seek solutions to Homelessness it would be a good start by offering access to public transport. This way we would offer them some respite and support that they need in order to improve their lives. Moreover, it would not cost us much as it is already there.
attributes.additional_details:
In the current climate Homelessness is rising and there are no easy solutions to this. Local Authorities are struggling to cope with the demand and are not able to house most people registered as Homeless due to the lack of Housing supply.

We believe that it would be only just fair that as a great country, United Kingdom would allow anyone who is registered as Homeless to have free public transport. This would enable them to go to work, attend job centres, hospital or housing appointments.

attributes.action: Ensure that students from year7 are taught in schools how to detect child abuse.
attributes.background: We're a group of students that believe that child abuse needs to be reduced. We have found astonishing figures that kids 4 years old and under are most affected. Most kids that have been physically, verbally or sexually abused are unaware that they are being abused as they don't understand the signs
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 5 children die every day because of child abuse and 1 out of 3 girls and 1 out of 5 boys will be sexually abused before they reach age 18.
For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering alone

attributes.action: Throw out plans requiring voters to produce ID at polling stations
attributes.background: The UK government has announced plans to trial asking voters to produce ID before being allowed to vote. If this law was to be passed then it will be unfairly affecting the poor, the marginalised, the homeless, the isolated and the most vulnerable sections of our society. It needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Ban fireworks outside of events on specific days across the UK.
attributes.background:
In the weeks around Bonfire Night, fireworks are constantly being let off causing nothing but worry for pet owners. 

The noise and vibrations from fireworks can cause severe distress in both wild and domestic animals, meaning that owners have to take steps to alleviate their distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Bonfire 'Night' is often spread over a fortnight. This means that owners can find it difficult to plan for their animals. Fireworks have caused distress to all kinds of animals, not just cats and dogs. Smaller animals, such as rabbits, and farm animals, such as horses, can be affected too. 

This petition is calling for the government to specify days of the year on which the use of fireworks is legal, e.g. 5th November, 31st December, Diwali, and to ban their use outside of these dates.

attributes.action: Stop passport checks on pregnant NHS patients
attributes.background: The proposals by St. George's University Hospital Trust, and backed by the Home Office, that pregnant people would be subject to mandatory passport checks before being able to access care to crack down on "health tourism" are deeply worrying, steeped in racism, and should be rejected immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal wards already require a form with proof of eligibility but these cannot always be done fully. The proposals would require checks to be stricter and could, in the view of multiple critics and medical staff, lead to higher risk to patient health. These proposals give no assurance that patients would have access to care regardless of immigration status, as is current government policy and law. Focus on "health tourism" is a racist smokescreen for the Conservatives' destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: The UK must ban the foreign financing of all new MOSQUES
attributes.background: As we go forward in the Uk,it has become apparent that the Uk like other European countries has a problem with the financing of mosques.We call on the government to ban all foreign finance from building or the planning of any new mosques

attributes.action: Urgently ban the use of preventative antibiotics in animal agriculture.
attributes.background: Antibiotics used in agriculture are a serious the threat to human health. Overuse is driving up levels of antibiotic resistance, leading to new superbugs. There must be a total ban on "preventative antibiotic use" where animals are given the drugs to prevent infection or speed up their growth.
attributes.additional_details:
This ban should also cover imported meat where antibiotics have been used. In many countries throughout the world animals use more antibiotics than humans. 

The use of antibiotics in farming represents a critical threat to public health. If antibiotics stop working, which is a distinct possibility, the outcome could be apocalyptic for humanity. We would go back to the days where a small cut or infection could be fatal.

No new antibiotics have been discovered since 1987.

attributes.action: Waive bridge tolls for motorists in Warrington, Chester and Cheshire West.
attributes.background: Motorists will have to pay to cross the new Mersey Gateway Bridge and existing silver Jublee bridge â despite some being promised tolls would be scrapped to save them Â£1,080 a year. Sign to show your support for scrapping these charges.

attributes.action: Election Manifestos of political parties must become legally binding contracts
attributes.background: The Parties publicly declare their policies that they promise to deliver if elected into office this is the Election Manifesto. There is no legal mechanism in place besides general/local elections to hold parties to account. Election Manifestos should be made into legally binding contracts.
attributes.additional_details:
If a elected government, local council, elected mayor or assembly breaks the contract they've delivered to the electorate. The party in question should be taken to the British Courts if found guilty the punishment should be a fine the payment would be from the parties own funding and not from the tax payer to deter uk parties from purposefully deceiving the electorate.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/notesandqueries/query/0,,-203998,00.html

http://www.thefreedictionary.com/Electoral+manifesto

attributes.action: Establish legal presumption of shared, 50:50, care after parents' break up
attributes.background:
The adversarial character of family legal system is not fit for purpose.
The bias of legal professionals ( lawers, social workers, caffcass officers, family centres staff, judges) is causing more harm then good . Simple initial presumption of 50 :50 child care split will give power back to parents
attributes.additional_details:
In Sweden approximately40% of separated parents share care 50:50 and it is higher amongst younger children.
In the majority of cases the minimum of shared parenting is 30%
Just 2% of disputes are resolved in court

attributes.action: Ban plastic staws or introduce a 5p charge for each one.
attributes.background: To help cut down on the amount of single use disposable plastics. As whether they are put in the bin or thrown on the floor the toxic chemicals still leak into our oceans and damage/kill marine life.

attributes.action: Allow all emergency services to use spit hoods!
attributes.background: Several infectious diseases are contained in saliva, I wish this subject to be discussed in Parliament and come down on the side of all emergency services.

attributes.action: Ban all religious practises from public outdoor areas.
attributes.background: Increasing trend of spreading religious practices, wordpship, prayers to parks, streets and in other public places directly discriminate non believing population and prevent peaceful coexistence of all religions with non believing population in the UK.

attributes.action: Overturn Chris Grayling's plan to create a road tunnel under Stonehenge on A303
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a World Heritage Site, famous worldwide. It is also a Part of OUR heritage and a Sacred Site to the Druids. The plan could cause irreparable damage to the site and cause it to be lost to future generations forever.
attributes.additional_details:
Last year, the historians Dan Snow and Tom Holland attacked the proposals, likening them to vandals destroying ancient artefacts. âWe have recently started to realise that the standing stones are just a beginning. They sit at the heart of the worldâs most significant and best-preserved stone-age landscape. The governmentâs plans endanger this unique site,â he said. 
Holland said: âThere is so much waiting to be learned about how Stonehenge was built â if we decide, as a country, not to sacrifice it to road building. The battle to save our most significant neolithic landscape is an unending one.â

attributes.action: Ensure fracking is not allowed near Sherwood Forest
attributes.background:
Following a Guardian article (see link below) we would like to ensure that Ineos and any other company is not allowed to begin fracking near the historic site of the Major Oak in Sherwood Forest. 

(https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/01/robin-hoods-sherwood-forest-faces-fracking-threat)

attributes.action: Change UK licensing laws to allow drug testing in nightclubs.
attributes.background: Despite current laws, 1 in 5 young adults used illicit drugs last year, of unknown purity and strength and have been attributed to the deaths of 50 people in 2014, a trend which is increasing. By allowing safe drug tests in venues, users will be aware of the composition and lives could be saved.
attributes.additional_details: Drug testing has been used in Europe and at UK festivals with Police and PHA support. There needs to be a debate on how this can be implemented across the night time industry so that it's customers can be as informed as they are with alcohol choices. The tragedy of these deaths is conversely having an impact on that economy. There were a further 14000 hospital admissions which is additional burden on the NHS. Statistics: http://digital.nhs.uk/catalogue/PUB21159/drug-misu-eng-2016-rep.pdf

attributes.action: State Pension Payable Immediately On Completion Of 40 Years N.I. Contributions
attributes.background: Recent State Pension changes means many people will contribute around 50 years N.I contributions before they will receive a State Pension, despite the Government themselves saying 35 years is the amount of contributions needed to create it in the first place.     Pay the pension at 40 years maximum.
attributes.additional_details: If your employer say they will pay you Â£10 per hour for a fifty hour week, then you only receive Â£350, you'd feel a little more than a little miffed - but that's exactly the "deal" we are being sold by the Government with increased retirement ages.     By their own admission, you need to pay N.I. contributions for 35 years to get a full State Pension.     So why are we expected to work longer?     Any individual completing 40 years contributions should have their pension payable from that point.

attributes.action: Form a Home or National Defence Force of HM Forces Veterans.
attributes.background: There are thousands of able and willing HM Forces Veterans who would step forward if required to form a Home or National Defence Force to assist in Border Protection or assistance to Police and regular Forces in times of emergency, or civil unrest.
attributes.additional_details: These Veterans are a valuable asset to this Nation, well trained, experienced and able to fulfill tasks and roles during times of emergency or civil unrest.

attributes.action: All income used by self funders to pay for care needs should not be taxed.
attributes.background: Phase Two of the Care Act 2014 has been delayed, resulting in self funders having to finance care needs until their assets, including the value of the family home, fall below Â£23,500.  The Act included a cap on the maximum fees that could be paid. Tax relief on income for this purpose would be fair.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government Care Act Fact Sheets state: 

"These reforms aim to give everyone the peace of mind that they will be protected from catastrophic care costs by means of a cap on care costs." 

Also "The cap will limit the amount people have to pay towards the cost of their eligible care and support over their lifetime."

Delay in implementation does not protect people receiving care âfrom catastrophic care costs by means of a capâ.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS wasting more time in the courts: Commission PrEP immediately.
attributes.background: PrEP stands for Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis. It's a course of HIV drugs for HIV negative people to take before sex to reduce their risk of contracting HIV. Research demonstrates that PrEP is as effective as condoms in preventing HIV transmission.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2016 NHS England stated that they were 'not responsible for commissioning PrEPâ. Following a legal challenge from the National AIDS Trust, which the NHS wasted time and money appealing, the Court of Appeal has ruled that the NHS has the legal power to fund PrEP. 

The NHSâs decision has already been delayed for over 6 months, so we urgently call on Jeremy Hunt to make PrEP available on the NHS. 

Every day the NHS delays its decision, 17 more people will be diagnosed with HIV.

attributes.action: After The EU, Let The Public Decide Where Â£350 Million A Week Should Be Spent .
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum held on June 23rd 2016, the public made a democratic decision not to spend Â£350 million a week on the EU. 

As the public made the democratic decision not to spend it on the EU, the public should now democratically decide what Â£350 million per week should then be spent on.
attributes.additional_details:
As Agriculture received the largest amount back from the money spent on EU membership, the government must pledge that the higher percentage of the money saved from not being in the EU will be spent on agriculture. 

Every 4 years the public should then have a democratic say on where the remaining percentage should be spent, through official voting on a ballot, with boxes asking if the money should be spent; either: completely on the NHS, on public services, or education. This must be honoured.

attributes.action: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided.
attributes.background: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided and therefore they should not use roadways or footpaths adjacent.
